author: {'steamid': '76561199168678810', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1680568518}
review: Out of my entire steam library, this is the first serious, actual game that I have outright disliked. That makes me sad because there's some stuff I actually like. The sound effects for example are really good, and just driving around and shooting baddies feels pretty alright. But everything else falls apart with two simple issues, no multiplayer, and poor balance. VOLTED isn't multiplayer for whatever reason, meaning that every game you'll play with have you paired with bots. The AI really needs some more work, because there's some crucial factors that just don't exist. The bots have no self preservation, and will charge blindly into battles at low health and travel in one big group constantly. The worst parts are the bot interactions with the player. First of all, teammate bots often prioritize following you over making their own offensive pushes, meaning that you can't sneakily flank anywhere without towing an army behind you. Secondly, the enemy bots have some programming in them to intentionally attack you over anyone else. This not only makes no sense from a commercial sense, but also makes a lot of the combat scenarios wretched. You can't poke out to fire at the enemy cluster without drawing a hail of bullets and shells at you. Enemy bots will completely ignore enemies closer to them to fire at you, they will avoid firing and die just to keep their eyes on you. My favorite way to abuse this aggressive AI is to get a group to follow you away from a pylon, leading them on a tour across the map while your teammate bots blow up the pylon with no opposition. Another big issue is how unbalanced a lot of mechanics are. For example, each class has a specific resource that it can share with other teammates. Most of these classes are not built for obvious support, making it difficult to both take advantage of your combat prowess and provide for your team at the same time. The only class + resource that synergies well is the artillery and it functioning as a respawn point, which is good due to artillery staying in the backlines most of the time. The only problem is that the ability to respawn on teammates, in any game, is the worst thing ever. I could write a novel about why, but this review is long enough already. Plenty of weapons, such as the sniper or cannon, were clearly not designed with the maps and gameplay in mind, and generally feel unfitting for the game you're playing. VOLTED has potential, and I could see myself enjoying it far more with some changes, but I simply cannot recommend buying it in the state that it's in.

author: {'steamid': '76561199031534647', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1663028281}
review: I first heard of this game when I had gotten a discount for it while crafting steam badges. Seeing that it was only 1.50 (USD) with the discount I decided to buy it because "it's only 1.50". I loaded up the game looked at the controls and classes then joined my first match. I have played some shooter games so I did better then most at the point of just joining and was having some fun. About 2.5 hours later I still have some fun with the game (it can get a bit boring some times) i was having to actually try to not die in gun fight but like I said before, still fun. I would say this is one of the games you play for 30 minutes every once in awhile but if you have the amount it costs to buy this game just laying around, I would buy it. This review doesn't go into all the mechanics or how fun it is in general but how fun it is from my prospective, and it's looking pretty good. go give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094021929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1658187051}
review:
A fast-paced team tank shooter. I got this as part of a publisher deal or something years ago, and honestly would not have bought it separately - it isn't the kind of game I typically enjoy.

I played a few matches anyway, It seems to have a pretty good player cohort, so that's good. In shooter games, graphics have always been very important to me, and VOLTED doesn't deliver very much on that front. The polygonal environment made everything seem pretty chaotic, it took me a several minutes just to orient myself after each spawn.

I'm sure there's a lot of fun to be had in this game, since many people are playing it, but it's just not my style.

author: {'steamid': '76561199042553082', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1624788677}
review: Volted, I enjoyed it immensely in the first hours of the game. But it becomes more and more repetitive and faints. Various shooting styles and weapons are put in, but only 2 or 3 types of weapons are useful and this makes it boring after a while as it always pushes to use the same weapons. It takes 10 15 hours to play the game to unlock all achievements and vehicles. The maps of the game are not too many, which makes you feel like you are doing the same things on the same maps after a while. The game is fun for 2 or 3 hours but if you want to unlock everything in the game you will be bored. Unfortunately, the game is not finished or has not been given much thought.

review: It's a bit simple but tons of fun with friends and a great way to kill time solo. There are a lot of sweet weapons and upgrades plus four different styles of vehicles. The cartoon-ish graphics are great and it's chaotic nature provides a lot of randomness to the fun. There is online play but not a ton of people playing sadly. Great score for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018910266', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1693723001}
review: Very simple but fun game, about cars destroying each other, bases and guarding robots with smgs, machine guns, cannon, ballistas, shotguns energy guns and sniper rifles. You got 4 car classes each with different stats, certain weapons and frames unlockables. Only two modes, base vs base, where you need to take out enemy base and protect yours and attack defence where you either only attack or defend the base. Even if player base is low, you always see bots fighting  each other and can still have alot of fun with them.

review: I think this game has the potential to be really fun. The only problem that I have is that the lack of real balance seems to be a big problem. You have these battles where anyone can spawn on another player, eventually leading to these battles that can go nowhere simply because both sides spawn in constantly. I feel like the towers are really easy to kill in some maps but impossible in others. As well as the different classes just not feeling good to play. I think it has potential but for now I'm hanging up on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354651705', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1592854648}
review:
A low-poly LoL-like arena game, with plenty of options for customization being unlocked as you level up each class. Warning: You will get pwned. You will lose. But you'll also have fun! I recommend Base Attack for newer players until you have some more decent vehicles and/or weapons unlocked, as Base vs Base is more difficult.

A neat feature is the name generator for each player: Instead of usernames, you'll see names likely selected from a list assigned to each player. This makes it more family-friendly, or as family-friendly as a third-person shooter with intense low-poly vehicular warfare can be. Also, the bugs are awesome. Whether that is in the Biblical or modern sense depends which side you're on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017329042', 'num_games_owned': 1912, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1572468688}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1563068505}
review:
15h update:

TL;DR is an entertaining game but has big flaws on gameplay and features:  movement is meh, bullets collision isn't consistent and the minions can walk/shoot through the geometry and there is no reward for killing/wining a match :/

Is entertaining game however falls very short on the gameplay and progression. Higher level weapons make less damage (wtf). 
Also the current state is unplayable because the mechanics aren't helpful. The spawn point is next to a base instead of the HQ - making harder to save your base :( ... and the bullets go where they want. The minion NPCs are way too overpower and 90% of the time spawn on top of me and kill with 1 hit (maybe is due the lag?).

There are only 2 game modes which limits the playability and there is no music (RIP) either in game or in the menu.

Finally, the AI is just broken.The enemy team has better weapons (more damage, accuracy and fire rate) also the AI NEVER runs out of bullets and can hit anyone from afar.

The thing I hate the most is that the few human players I encounter just camp ._. 

Nevertheless, this is a good indie game and the price is just right. I hope to see some improvements/features over time.
developer_response:
It's sad that you didn't like the game :(

Maybe I can help you to understand some design goals of this game.

1) No weapon or class or vehicle is better than the other, they should be "different". You can find slow and inaccurate, but powerful weapon, or fast and very accurate. They are all procedural, so yes of course there will be some luck involved. Find the one that suits your style and mood and stick with it for some time.

2) Teamwork is essential. You simply won't survive without your team. Want unlimited bullets? Get a team mate who plays a tank nearby. Hovers give health, copters give shields, tanks give bullets and artillery give spawn points (you should not be under attack for some time to receive resources)

3) Spawn point is on the base and on the artillery class team mates. The artillery class should be behind the lines (sort of), that's why they have only long range weapon classes. You should protect them, and wipe out enemy artillery if you want to stop the attack, because if you don't they will continue to respawn on artilleries (so should you too if you want to continue attacking that point).

And I can assure you that there are simply no cheats in AI, they play by the same rules as you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030027926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1562488692}
review:
Ha!

Bloody awesome little game!

No instructions needed just choose your vehicle type, weapon, custom colors and livery if you like and then off you go
into two different types of games

 1. Base VS Base
 2. Assault on Enemy Base

Every time your vehicle gets destroyed you have a choice to respawn as any of the vehicles still currently on the field replacing it with your default choice

Unlock better vehicles and weaponry as you win battles

No campaign but you can invite Steamers in your friends list if they have the game as well
A.I. is decent enough to enjoy games alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991488767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1560509199}
review: Low poly eye bleeding hell. Infinite meat grinder. Low cost. Lots of fun

author: {'steamid': '76561197961053737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1688850870}
review:
This is a labor of love. The gameplay is surprisingly tactical, since every tank class also has an important passive capability (healing, shield, ammo, respawn) - if nobody plays as artillery you're going to lose. If nobody plays tank you're going to lose. etc... Multiplayer works great even though it's a bit opaque, as there's no server list. Just hit play and invite friends. On the plus side, there's always someone to play against, as the game features automatic balancing with bots. This is key to keeping a game interesting even when there's few people on, and I'm glad the developer has put this in.

You can do much worse for 5 bucks. I'm giving this a thumbs up. If the developer keeps adding interesting gameplay elements then he could easily up the price lateron too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063401187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1671094327}
review:
I'm a very proud skeptical person and I usually don't like PvP games, Indie games, no story games and potato graphics games. Which meant I never even considered purchasing this until recently when I got a 75% discout coupon, so decided to spend 0.99‚Ç¨ on it thinking it would be a mistake because [i]"Indie games are all trash"[/i] I thought.

But boy was I wrong.

I don't even know where to start. Just the sheer simplicity of the game and smoothness when running is astonishing. It's just so simple, the menus, the mechanics of the game, everything. It's made in such a way it's physically impossible for someone to be a noob or a pro at it, in my first game I ended up killing 30 dudes and dying 6 times whilst having absolutely no idea what I was doing. It was just sheer fun.
Also, the game is so well optimised, I forget I'm playing in a 7 year old computer with a tendency to make me cry. I don't know how the game does it, But it just runs so damn well even a 12 year old half baked pentium laptop could run it smoothly.
Sadly, like any other trashy battle royal game it has no purpose or content to keep you motivated except the fun of doing matches and kill dudes. Which means this game is only good until you get tired of the gameplay. Because there's literally nothing else to it. Which would be bad for an expensive game but for a 4‚Ç¨ base price game? Meh not bad.

Overall It's an extremely well made game, that puts many others to shame in terms of optimisation and simplicity.
It's well worth it's price and has steam achievements to keep you interested, just don't expect it to be more than it is. A fun little game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991303441', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1546084648}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114416094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1585959123}
review:
Voici un petit jeu d√©fouloir bien sympathique. Ici il n'y a pas de strat√©gie √† proprement parler, personne ne te demande r√©fl√©chir, il n'y a pas de classement non plus parce qu‚Äôon s'en fout un peu, le but n‚Äô√©tant pas de te mettre sur un podium. Tu a ton v√©hicule arm√©, des antennes √† d√©truire et c'est tout. Rien de bien compliqu√©.
Cot√© graphique il fait saigner un peu des yeux mais bon si tu a un compte steam avec plusieurs heures de jeu, c'est que la sant√© de tes yeux ne te pr√©occupe pas. On s'y habitue assez vite.

Cot√© contenue, c'est assez riche pour un d√©but. Tu peux changer les armes et m√™me changer de couleur des parties sp√©cifique du v√©hicule. Les armes ont des effets diff√©rente, fort agr√©able pour les yeux aussi :)
Et pour INFO quand tu ach√®te le jeu, tout est d√©bloqu√©. Tu n'a pas √† d√©penser de l'argent in-game pour modifier un truc. Il faut juste jouer et tu d√©bloque en progressant. 

Je ne regrette pas cette achat. Si tu h√©site √† l'acheter, ben passe ton chemin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058249737', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1531258354}
review:
I saw that game first time on expo a year ago with the name Volts and Bolts.
A game from one developer. With multiplayer, AI, lots of guns, maps. He quit his job to make the indie game. 
Damn I was impressed (:
And now the release.
Crazy battles in cartoon style, lots of fun, cute animation of UI.
And there's one more pleasant thing.
Like the great russian writer Chekhov once said, a game should be beautiful in every way‚Äîin its fun, in the gameplay, in animation and in its discount also.
You should try it (:

author: {'steamid': '76561198218072373', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1531260936}
review: What if Machines: Wired For War by Charybdis Ltd. (1999) had no base building mechanics, but a REAL first-/third-person online gameplay with teamwork? This game is it, except for the Judas (but I've pointed that out to developer... who knows?).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037738622', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1553701782}
review: At first I was very sceptical about this game. Well, I admit that I was wrong. It can be fun. No. It IS fun. Action is pretty fast-paced, controls are tight, performance is good. The only thing this game lacks is some aggressive electronic music but I hope that developer will add it really soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198391638563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3356, 'last_played': 1656431196}
review: magnifique petit jeu qui au premier abord rebute un poil par ses graphismes simplistes mais le gameplay est tellement jouissif et le fun imm√©diat qu'on se laisse happer par le schmurtz!je suis  bien d'accord avec cette petite crotte de travis.bones ;)   2 camps s'affrontent , un qui d√©fend les pylones l'autre qui les attaque , tout √ßa en 15 mn. clavier et manettes enti√®rement configurables , truff√© de bonnes petites id√©es , avec une programmation de bots bluffante d'humanit√© , bref je conseille ce jeu -no-pay-to-win- aux grands et aux moins grands ! 4 balles ! le prix d'un demi-paquet de clopes ! ;) poil aux femmes qui boivent du yop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076005109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1526226375}

Quelques petits upgrade manquent au jeu mais d√©but tr√®s prometteur!! On veut d'autres map et mods!!!! Lachez rieeeeeeen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119008413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1572740241}
review:
Let's Play: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQscEBjbQqU&t=329s
Gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bMwkAkHlkis&t=54s

Sch√∂ner Online-Multiplayer-Shooter. Jede Runde dauert 15 Minuten, die aber wie im Flug vergehen. Das Spiel hat noch viel Potenzial nach oben, wei√ü aber jetzt schon zu √ºberzeugen. 

Spielmodus 1: √úbernehme die Rolle der Angreifer oder der Verteidiger und greife entsprechend die verschiedenen Basen an, oder verteidige deine Basen.

Spielmodus 2: Base VS Base, hier musst Du die anderen Basen angreifen und gleichzeitig darauf achten, das Du im gegebenen Fall Deine Basen verteidigst.


Das ganze Herumgeballere, die um einen herumfliegenden Geschosse, die gut spielenden Bots, eine gut funktionierende Steuerung und die witzige Grafik machen richtig Spa√ü.
